DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure First Diagnosis Prostate-Specific Antigen Outcome Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to indicate the particular day, month and year in which the initial result from a procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting recognized the presence of prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) encoded by the human KLK3 gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure First Diagnosis Prostate-Specific Antigen Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related the results of the initial medical procedure that diagnosed the presence of disease by testing a sample of blood for prostate-specific antigen, a substance produced by the prostate that may be found in an increased amount in the blood of men who have prostate cancer, benign prostatic hyperplasia, or infection or inflammation of the prostate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
